content: 1 half_double_crochet in each double_crochet across turn r51 chain 2 double_crochet in each half_double_crochet across turn r52 chain 1 half_double_crochet in each double_crochet across turn r53 chain 2 double_crochet in each half_double_crochet across turn r54 chain 1 half_double_crochet in each double_crochet across turn finish off sew in ends part 5 lay part 3/4 out flat and lay part 1 and part 2 with the ws this will be your choice since neither side is a blatant rs or ws facing up on either short end make sure the snowman is oriented so that the hat is closest to part 3/4 make sure the snowflake is oriented so the 3 small snowflakes are closest to part 3/4 you should have 19 sts on the short edges of all the parts hold the edges of part 3/4 and part 1 together again with ws of part 1 facing you and slip_stitch through both in each of the 19 sts i used the parts 3/4 yarn for this part repeat on the other end of part 3/4 with part 2 with ws of part 2 facing you optional single_crochet around the entire scarf to make a nice edge i used the part 3/4 yarn for this enjoy your winter wonderland keyhole scarf
